meanings.sent1: Using an old phone model can antiquate you in the eyes of your friends.
meanings.sent2: Technology advances quickly, making some devices antiquate faster than others.
meanings.sent3: Wearing bell-bottoms today would certainly antiquate your fashion sense!
meanings.sent4: His love for vinyl records never antiquates, even in the age of digital music.
meanings.sent5: The classic car's design never antiquates; it remains timeless and elegant.

meanings.definition: To cause to become old or dated.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the painting in the sun will antiquate its colors over time.
meanings.sent2: Exposure to harsh weather conditions can antiquate outdoor furniture quickly.
meanings.sent3: His habit of using a flip phone may antiquate him among his tech-savvy peers.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ruins antiquate the modern city, reminding us of the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The old photographs antiquate the memories, preserving moments in faded hues.
